report.title: Report
report.intro: Help the fight against the new Coronavirus in Sweden by self-reporting your health status. This website visualizes the progression of the Covid-19 pandemic in our country using risk maps generated with help of your self-reported data.
report.contract: Did you contract Covid-19 and recovered?
report.notSick3: for updates on quarantine for healthy people.
report.contracted: Regarding your recent social contacts, do you think you contracted Covid-19?
report.contractedOfficialConfirmText: Have you been officially tested positive to Covid-19 by a recognized medical institution?
report.locationValidError: Please enter a valid swedish postal number
report.errorDetails: An error occurred when sending your data
report.sentComeBack: Thank you for your contribution. Please come back if your health status changes.
report.sentSomeoneElse: If you want to file a report for someone else, please use another phone, tablet or computer.
report.sentMistake: You've made a mistake ? You can correct it :

visualize.title: Visualize
visualize.dataWarning: The following data is community collected and not verified.

about.title: About us
about.headWho: We are a team of epidemiologists, computer scientists, and developers
about.who: from KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm University, and Mid Sweden University that want to help the current situation of the COVID-19 pandemic in our country, Sweden.
about.needYou: Our webapp is based on your self-reporting... so it is important that you update your health status in case of change. Just use the same brower whenever you want to report a development of your symptoms or COVID status.
about.headData: We do not save any personal information on our servers!
about.data: All data is anonymous but to keep our dataset consistent, we require that you always use the same browser to update your status (otherwise you will be counted twice).
about.headDataUpdate: Realtime risk map to safely walk through the city.
about.dataUpdate: are working on that as hard as we can and hopefully would release it as soon as possible. But due to the lack of sponsors, we are slower than what we would love to be.
about.publicData: our dataset is public and open in our github. Please use it to make your own awesome visualization, or join our effort.
about.dataCare: keep in mind that our dataset is based on self-reporting from the community, thus the data is not official and could contains errors. The data is only intended to be used as an indicator.
about.improvement: for improvements or you want to report an error, please contact us via email:
about.support: Any help (resources, developers, outreach, language, etc.) is more than welcome.
about.source1: This webapp is based on open source
about.source2: , which is updated to the statistics of Sweden.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.goalQuestion: What is the goal of this app?
faq.goalResponse: Crowdsourcing a live risk map can help build a more accurate picture of the spread of Covid-19 during the pandemic and help our family, friends, and vulnerable groups to stay safe by highlighting high-risk areas. Such a tool has the potential to to save lives, reduce the burden on healthcare providers, improve quality of life in the community, and flatten the pandemic curve.
faq.othersQuestion: How do I report other members of my family?
faq.othersResponse: We are working on this issue. For now, you can use a different device (phone, tablet, computer) for each member of your family.

team.title: Team
team.description: Initiated by a Ph.D. student of KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sina Molavipour, WeCare is a cross-platform, resilient, and privacy-preserving solution that combines contact, environmental and symptom risks into a single integrated risk value, and enables contact tracing. Launching COVIDmap was the first step toward the WeCare concept and solution. We are a team of epidemiologists, computer scientists, and developers from KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm University, and Mid Sweden University that want to help the current situation of the COVID-19 pandemic in our country, Sweden.
